intro: Brassica rostrata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, round pods containing several seeds. Brassica rostrata is often found in disturbed soils and can be an invasive species in some areas.
